tutorial.title: Linktree - Part 4
tutorial.descriptionContent: Get ready to build your very own Linktree-style page, where you can showcase all your socials and other links you care about in one spot.

executableContent.instructions:
Your page looks good, but we can use AI to make it look even better! Let's change the page's background from a solid color to a gradient.

1. Ask AI to replace the `background-color` with `background: linear-gradient`.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Emmy

Aspiring Software Developer

Welcome to my page! I'm Emmy, an aspiring software developer. Follow my journey by checking out my social media profiles. Happy coding!

Instagram TikTok

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
The property `background: linear-gradient(slateblue, lightblue);` creates a gradient showing one color at the top and another at the bottom. We can also change the direction of the gradient. Let's do that!

1. Add `to right`, followed by a comma, before the first color to define the direction of the gradient. Like this: `background: linear-gradient(to right, ...`

files.content:

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Let's go back to the HTML file so we can add icons to each link. To do this, we use a service called **Font Awesome**. The first step is to reference Font Awesome's style sheet, which is available for everyone over the internet.

1. To avoid typing a long URL, ask AI to link the Font Awesome Icon's stylesheet to your HTML.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions: Now that the style sheet is referenced in your HTML code, we can add icons. But before we do that, we need an empty element that will be the wrapper for the icon. 1. Between the `a` opening and closing tags, just before the content, add an `i` tag by coding ``. 2. Make sure to do it for all links.

executableContent.instructions: To add an icon, we reference it by adding the `class` attribute. 1. Inside the opening `` tag, add the attribute `class="fab fa-instagram"` (or `fab fa-tiktok`, `fab fa-linkedin`, etc. ) It'll look like this: ``.
